item.title: Aesopica: part 1
item.description: The stories of attributed to Aesop, called Aesop’s Fables or the Aesopica, are one the most ancient collection of stories that have been passed down to modern day. Of diverse origins they cover a wide variety of themes. Although originally intended for an adult audience, in later times were often used for the education of children. One of such stories is the tale of the Fox and the Stork. There are many version of this fable, but the overall outline is generally as follows:
